claim.text: Single agent structures perform better than multi-agent structures for fundamental and sentiment analysis tasks
claim.exact_quote: for fundamental analysis, a single agent outperforms larger groups. As the size of the agent group increases, performance decreases. A similar trend is observed in the sentiment analysis task

evidence.evidence_text: Fundamental analysis scores: Single: 4.70, Dual: 4.17, Triple: 3.97
evidence.limitations: Evaluation scores are based on GPT-4 assessment which may introduce bias

evidence.evidence_text: Sentiment analysis scores showing similar pattern
evidence.limitations: Small differences between scores may not be statistically significant

evaluation.justification: Consistent pattern across multiple metrics and tasks with quantitative evidence
evaluation.key_limitations: Relies on GPT-4 for evaluation scoring, limited sample size of 30 companies

claim.text: Triple agent groups perform better for complex risk analysis tasks
claim.exact_quote: for risk analysis, a group of three agents performs the best, while a single agent shows the poorest performance

evidence.evidence_text: Risk analysis scores showing triple agents outperforming
evidence.limitations: Small differences in scores, potential evaluation bias

evaluation.justification: Quantitative evidence supports claim though differences are modest
evaluation.key_limitations: Limited sample size, subjective complexity assessment of tasks

claim.text: Ensemble structure outperforms other structures in investment decision accuracy
claim.exact_quote: the ensemble structure successfully predicted the movements of 20 stocks, achieving a prediction accuracy of 66.7%, whereas the full vertical agent structure only achieved 50%

evidence.limitations: Limited test period of one week

evidence.exact_quote: Avg. Diff. to Target: Ensemble 2.35%, Dual 2.24%, Others 2.43-4.75%

evaluation.justification: Consistent superior performance across multiple metrics with significant margins
evaluation.key_limitations: Short prediction timeframe, limited to 30 stocks
